text:
Hi guys,

Two days ago I published the fourth post in the series and thought it would now be a good time to look for additional feedback here on Hacker News.

The aim of the series (as mentioned in the first post) is to inspire more people to start using Qt. My ambition is to answer the following questions "what is the gist of Qt?"; "what is the 20%!t(MISSING)hat you need to know to develop 80%!o(MISSING)f the application?"; "what are the perhaps unknown unknowns?". In other words, I'm just covering basics: enough to understand the concepts and where to find additional information should you need it.

Do you agree with the direction of the series so far? Here is the link to the first post:

https://www.cleanqt.io/blog/crash-course-in-qt-for-c%!B(MISSING)%!B(MISSING)-d...

I appreciate your time and would be very happy if you had any feedback.
title: Show HN: Crash course in Qt for C++ developers â€“ a blog post series
